intro: Skirrhophorus strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a single, elongated head, typical of the family Asteraceae. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Skirrhophorus strictus is often found in disturbed soils and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
